text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSMedicationPrescription

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSMedicationPrescription 0..*EHDSDataSet
Elements defined in Ancestors:header, presentedForm
Medication prescription model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
header 1..*BasePrescription header
subject 1..1EHDSPatientThe person for whom the medication is prescribed/ordered. [Used for searching]
identifier 0..*IdentifierBusiness identifier(s) for the prescription. [Used for searching]
authorship
author[x] 1..1EHDSHealthProfessional, EHDSOrganization, EHDSDeviceThe prescriber, the person who made the prescription, and who takes the responsibility of the treatment. [Used for searching]
datetime 1..1dateTimeTime of issuing (signing) the prescription by health care professional. [Used for searching]
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus of the prescription, this should not be status of treatment. For multi-item prescription, the status of prescription is often related to statuses of single lines. In case of single-item prescriptions, the status for line is usually the status of prescription. [Used for searching]
statusReason[x] 0..1CodeableConcept, stringReason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous
recorder 0..1EHDSHealthProfessionalThe recorder of the prescription/draft in the information system
recordingDate 0..1dateTimeTime of authoring the prescription/draft in the information system
validFrom 0..1dateTimeEffective date of the prescription. The prescription is not dispensable before this date. In most cases this information repeats issueDate. [Used for searching]
validUntil 0..1dateTimeThe validity period end date. The prescription is not dispensable after this date. [Used for searching]
presentedForm 0..*EHDSAttachmentEntire prescription as issued. Various formats could be provided, PDF format is recommended.
comment 0..*stringAdditional information or comments
prescriptionItem 1..*BasePrescription line for one medication. In many countries, only one item is allowed. In case multiple medications are allowed, all lines need to be authored together.
identifier 0..1IdentifierIdentifier for a single item on prescription, if exists. In case of single-item prescription, this identifier is typically the same as prescription identifier.
category 0..*CodeableConceptCategory or categories of prescription. For example type of reimbursement, or type of prescription (e.g. hospital, private, etc).
medication 1..1EHDSMedicationPrescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc
indication[x] 0..*Reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): shall we have a preferred binding here?


indicationCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
indicationEHDSConditionEHDSCondition
indicationText 0..1stringReason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.
prescriptionIntent 0..1CodeableConceptIntent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc
treatmentPeriod 0..1PeriodPeriod over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)
quantityPrescribed 0..1QuantityOverall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).
dosageInstructions 0..*EHDSDosagingDosaging and administration instructions
preparationInstructions 0..1stringAdditional instructions about preparation or dispense
substitution 0..1BaseWhether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment item
allowed[x] 0..1Whether and to what extent substitution is allowed.
allowedBooleanboolean
allowedCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reason[x] 0..1Reason for the substitution requirement
reasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reasonStringstring
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus of a single item of a multi-item prescription. In case of single-item prescriptions, the status of prescription has the same meaning as the status of the item.
statusReason[x] 0..1Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous
statusReasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
statusReasonStringstring
repeatsAllowed 0..1integerNumber of refills authorized
minimumDispenseInterval 0..1DurationMinimum Dispense Interval
offLabel 0..1BaseIndicates that the prescriber has knowingly prescribed the medication for an indication, age group, dosage, or route of administration that is not approved by the regulatory agencies and is not mentioned in the prescribing information for the drug
isOffLabelUse 1..1booleanIndicates off-label use. Must be 'true' when .reason is provided.
reason[x] 0..*Reason or related clarification for off-label use
reasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reasonStringstring
comment 0..*stringAdditional information or comments

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSMedicationPrescription
title: Medication prescription model
description: Logical model for medication prescription. A prescription contains one or more prescription items.

element.short: Medication prescription model
element.definition: Logical model for medication prescription. A prescription contains one or more prescription items.

element.short: Prescription header
element.definition: Prescription header data elements

element.short: The person for whom the medication is prescribed/ordered. [Used for searching]
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier(s) for the prescription. [Used for searching]
element.definition: Business identifier for the object

element.short: Authorship
element.definition: Resource authoring details

element.short: The prescriber, the person who made the prescription, and who takes the responsibility of the treatment. [Used for searching]
element.definition: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

element.short: Time of issuing (signing) the prescription by health care professional. [Used for searching]
element.definition: Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the document/information

element.short: Status of the prescription, this should not be status of treatment. For multi-item prescription, the status of prescription is often related to statuses of single lines. In case of single-item prescriptions, the status for line is usually the status of prescription. [Used for searching]
element.definition: Status of the resource

element.short: Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.

element.short: Language
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Version
element.definition: Business version of the resource.

element.short: Entire prescription as issued. Various formats could be provided, PDF format is recommended.
element.definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

element.short: The recorder of the prescription/draft in the information system
element.definition: The recorder of the prescription/draft in the information system

element.short: Time of authoring the prescription/draft in the information system
element.definition: Time of authoring the prescription/draft in the information system

element.short: Effective date of the prescription. The prescription is not dispensable before this date. In most cases this information repeats issueDate. [Used for searching]
element.definition: Effective date of the prescription. The prescription is not dispensable before this date. In most cases this information repeats issueDate. [Used for searching]

element.short: The validity period end date. The prescription is not dispensable after this date. [Used for searching]
element.definition: The validity period end date. The prescription is not dispensable after this date. [Used for searching]

element.short: Additional information or comments
element.definition: Additional information or comments

element.short: Prescription line for one medication. In many countries, only one item is allowed. In case multiple medications are allowed, all lines need to be authored together.
element.definition: Prescription line for one medication. In many countries, only one item is allowed. In case multiple medications are allowed, all lines need to be authored together.

element.short: Identifier for a single item on prescription, if exists. In case of single-item prescription, this identifier is typically the same as prescription identifier.
element.definition: Identifier for a single item on prescription, if exists. In case of single-item prescription, this identifier is typically the same as prescription identifier.

element.short: Category or categories of prescription. For example type of reimbursement, or type of prescription (e.g. hospital, private, etc).
element.definition: Category or categories of prescription. For example type of reimbursement, or type of prescription (e.g. hospital, private, etc).

element.short: Prescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc
element.definition: Prescribed product, branded, generic, virtual, extemporal, etc

element.short: Reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)
element.definition: Reason for the prescription (typically diagnosis, or a procedure)

binding.description: shall we have a preferred binding here?

element.short: Reason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.
element.definition: Reason for the prescription in textual form. This might not be allowed by some implementations.

element.short: Intent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc
element.definition: Intent of the prescription - prophylaxis, treatment, anesthesia, etc

element.short: Period over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)
element.definition: Period over which the medication is to be taken (in case of multiple dosaging schemes, this would be the overall period of all dosages.)

element.short: Overall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).
element.definition: Overall quantity of prescribed product (e.g number of packages or number of tablets).

element.short: Dosaging and administration instructions
element.definition: Dosaging and administration instructions

element.short: Additional instructions about preparation or dispense
element.definition: Additional instructions about preparation or dispense

element.short: Whether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment item
element.definition: Whether and which type of substitution is allowed for this medication treatment item

element.short: Whether and to what extent substitution is allowed.
element.definition: Whether and to what extent substitution is allowed.

element.short: Reason for the substitution requirement
element.definition: Reason for the substitution requirement

element.short: Status of a single item of a multi-item prescription. In case of single-item prescriptions, the status of prescription has the same meaning as the status of the item.
element.definition: Status of a single item of a multi-item prescription. In case of single-item prescriptions, the status of prescription has the same meaning as the status of the item.

element.short: Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous
element.definition: Reason for the current status of prescription, for example the reason why the prescription was made invalid or why the prescription was changed from previous

element.short: Number of refills authorized
element.definition: How many times the prescription item can be dispensed in addition to the original dispense.

element.short: Minimum Dispense Interval
element.definition: If a prescription allows for repeated dispensations, the interval between dispensations shall be stated here.

element.short: Indicates that the prescriber has knowingly prescribed the medication for an indication, age group, dosage, or route of administration that is not approved by the regulatory agencies and is not mentioned in the prescribing information for the drug
element.definition: Indicates that the prescriber has knowingly prescribed the medication for an indication, age group, dosage, or route of administration that is not approved by the regulatory agencies and is not mentioned in the prescribing information for the drug

element.short: Indicates off-label use. Must be 'true' when .reason is provided.
element.definition: Indicates off-label use. Must be 'true' when .reason is provided.

element.short: Reason or related clarification for off-label use
element.definition: Reason or related clarification for off-label use

element.short: Additional information or comments
element.definition: Additional information or comments
